titleStmt.title: S. Gatewood and T. E. Skidmore to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9991

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: Affixed to this letter is a petition to the Governor to remit a fine against Barney Wells of our county, he only had a little fight with Mr S. Jackson who it seems was as willing or more so than him to engage in one and now is in jail.
If you will attend to this early it will accomodate not only him but all of the Signers to the paper
Let me hear from you early as is important if attended to at all

Yours Respectfully
S Gatewood
T. E. Skidmore

N. B. Early attention if you please
X

Trimble J. P.
Wells Case
Fine $10 --
Respite 6 mos
B. M
Barney Wells
Issd Jany 24 1861
